results.title: Radio day
results.brief_description: A promotional exercise that shows a day in the life of radio station 3XY in Melbourne. Although most of the activities carried out in a commercial radio station are depicted, there is no attempt to explain why and as such this production does little to demystify the process. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Conrad Martens
results.creator_credit: Clytie Jessop and National Trust of Australia
results.brief_description: Concerns the life and work of early Colonial artist Conrad Martens whose paintings and sketches are a valuable historical record of Australia. Deals with Marten’s work in England, his voyage on “The Beagle” and his friendship with Charles Darwin, and his output in Sydney.

results.title: Shadow panic
results.brief_description: I am the dreamer, the redhead. I search for hidden treasure: which fragment would yield gold, which memory would haunt forever? Three women, strangers to each other, yet their lives seem inexplicably linked. “Shadow Panic” is a short experimental film about internal and external states of emergency, about personal and collective shadows, about resistance and spirit.

results.title: Pattern of life
results.creator_credit: Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings, Judy Campbell and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: Bark painting - inseparable from the social, cultural and religious life of many Australian First Nations peoples - shown as it is today to satisfy the demands of a commercial market and as it was, the changing pattern of the life of the First Nations peoples being reflected in their paintings. Illustrations in Arnhem Land range from the fishing and hunting, musicians and dancing, to fighting, and mourning and burial ceremonies. In its western region we see various animal and plant totems in the attractive “x-ray” style, whilst elsewhere wind designs, clusters of stars, cycad and hibiscus trees are depicted.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings, Judy Campbell and Collings Productions

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings, Judy Campbell and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: An exploration of Australian First Nations rock paintings in Arnhem Land that attempts to capture the cultural and spiritual significance and meaning of the art to the local peoples.

results.title: Mamadrama
results.creator_credit: Monique Schwarz, Amber Films, Arte and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: An Australian documentary examining the portrayal of Jewish mothers on the big screen. From an early age filmmaker Monique Schwarz was puzzled by the discrepancy between the domineering and emasculating Jewish mothers typically represented on film, and her own mother, a Holocaust survivor. “Mamadrama” consequently has a strong personal touch, via the reflections of Schwarz and interviews with directors Paul Mazursky, Paul Bogart, and Larry Peerce, and actress Lainie Kazan. In addition to well-known Hollywood movies “Mamadrama” uses rare footage from early silent films, Yiddish language features and Israeli films. The tone of the documentary is reflective rather than critical; the most intriguing moments emerge from the candour with which the interviewees discuss their own mothers.

results.title: The Gulf between
results.brief_description: Fired from 1000 kilometers away, 39 scud missiles hit Israel during the Gulf War. Two people died as a result of direct hits. Twelve people died from related causes. Thousands of buildings were destroyed. For Israelis the impact of this war spread far beyond this… This documentary uncovers the personal feelings and stories of six ordinary Israelis as they reflect on their experiences during the Gulf War and their belief in the hatred towards Israel by the surrounding Arab States. It would appear that most Israelis want peace but do not agree on how to achieve this end - resigned to the fact that perhaps co-existence with the Palestinians is the only way. However, the Israelis have lived through many wars: War of Independence (1948); Suez crisis (1956); Six Day War (1967); Yom Kippur War (1973); Lebanon War (1982); and are determined not to back down from their fight to keep Israel as the rightful home for Jewish people. Contains strong images of the aftermath of the Gulf War, archival footage of the Holocaust and interviews.

results.title: Up in the sky: Tracey Moffatt in New York
results.creator_credit: Jane Cole and Jane Cole Productions
results.brief_description: This frank and insightful documentary focuses on the work of Australian photographic artist and filmmaker, Tracey Moffat. The film has Moffat discussing her work in her exhibition - Up In The Sky, on the eve of its opening at the prestigious gallery Dia Centre for the Arts, New York, (Oct. 1997) as the first Australian artist to be represented in the gallery. The exhibition housed four bodies of work; Night Cries: A rural tragedy (90), Guapa (95), Heaven (97) and Up In The Sky (97). Other works discussed are; Something More (89) and Scarred for Life (94). The artist provides an understanding to her motivations and techniques employed in the construction of her work.

results.title: Not fourteen again
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Jenny Day, Big Picture Company and Spirited Films
results.brief_description: Not fourteen again is the fourth in a series of film documentaries about the social histories of three working class women. The series examines the womens’ achievements, failures and changing attitudes. In this episode the women are mothers and wives in their thirties. Their teenage daughters, who are now at the age their mothers were when the series began are documented with equal importance. “Not fourteen again” presents a personal account of three young women and Armstrong, who is by now an old friend, builds a fascinating document.

results.title: Vacant possession
results.creator_credit: Margot Nash, John Winter, As If Productions, Australian Film Commission and Wintertime Films
results.brief_description: Following her mother’s death, Tessa returns to Australia and to her family home, a sun bleached weatherboard adjacent to Botany Bay. She confronts the collected debris of memory; the fears, the tears and the spectre of the father who forced her flee. Tessa’s home is close to that of an Aboriginal family she knew as a child. During her 20 year absence the nation has changed but not that house. In confronting her father, both the real and the remembered amidst the remains of the old home, the past and present collide in a maelstrom of unexpected ramifications. A brooding and atmospheric piece of cinema, Margot Nash’s first feature is an ambitious drama addressing hearth and place, rememberance and regret in a contemporary setting. Starring Pamela Rabe, John Stanton, Toni Scanlon, Linden Wilkinson, Rita Bruce and Olivia Patten.
